result.execSummary:
The defendant Melvin Monroe Matthews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endangering Safety By Use Of A Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety By Use Of A Dangerous Weapon (Pointing)

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Sign up for probation no later than 5:00 p.m.

miscConds.notes:
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No illegal drugs or alcohol.
No prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.

Submit a DNA sample by 5:00 p.m. and pay the surcharge during probation. Failure ot pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

timeConds.notes: IMPOSED AND STAYED:  To be used at the discretion of the agent.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Melvin Monroe Matthews in court.  Attorney Munjed A. Ahmad in court for Melvin Monroe Matthews.  
Attorney Katrina Voge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case 
for the purpose of sentencing. 

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant ordered to serve 9 MONTHS STRAIGHT TIME, consecutive, in the House of Correction, credit of 1 day time served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:

AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant ordered to serve 9 MONTHS STRAIGHT TIME, consecutive, in the House of Correction, credit of 0 days time served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 5:00 pm.
- Court imposed and stayed 45 days condition time as to each count.  The 90 days to be used at the discretion of the agent.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. 
- No illegal drugs or alcohol.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription
- Obtain/maintain full time work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Submit a DNA sample by 5:00 pm and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-6-22, filed.  rmm

Defendant Melvin Monroe Matthews in court.  Attorney Munjed A. Ahmad in court for Melvin Monroe Matthews.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
OFF THE RECORD.  Status conference held.  Atty. Ahmad requests a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-6-22, filed.  rmm

Defendant Melvin Monroe Matthews in court with attorney Munjed A. Ahmad.  
Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Atty. Ahmad requests one more status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Melvin Monroe Matthews in court with attorney Munjed A. Ahmad.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Melvin Monroe Matthews appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for status. Defense has discovery but needs and offer and requests an adjournment. Case adjourned to Br 01.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Appointing Counsel at County Expense, signed and filed.  rmm

Defendant Melvin Monroe Matthews in court.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom.  Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Munjed Ahmad as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Ahmad accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing 7/01/22 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court ordered no contact with Alisse A.S.; Charisse L.S.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Melvin Monroe Matthews in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Melvin Monroe Matthews in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Melvin Monroe Matthews appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.   DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Indigency hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/13/2022@2:30pm
